intro: Eriogonum zapatoense, commonly known as Zapato's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes other plants known for their distinctive leaf structures. Eriogonum zapatoense is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
